bib.title: Where should I publish? Heterogeneous, networks-based prediction of paper’s citation success
bib.author: Klemi{\'n}ski, Rajmund and Kazienko, Przemyslaw and Kajdanowicz, Tomasz
bib.abstract: Scientific output, as measured in research published annually, has seen a consistent growth for decades now. As more manuscripts are submitted for publication each year, new publishing venues appear–often as increasingly specialised offshoots of existing journals and conferences. This situation presents scholars with a wealth of publishing venues to consider and choose from for their manuscripts. Surprisingly, we find that the most cited papers are not necessarily found in the highest-ranked journals, while the best conferences
